description: Retrospective application for the retention of the new residential block comprising 6no. flats as a variation to planning permission P0015.17.
decision_conditions: Within two months of the date of this decision, the sight lines and visibility splays as shown on drawings numbered 123Fand 124B shall be provided to both sides of the vehicular access(es) to the site, and retained as such in accordance with the approved details thereafter with no further structure or erection exceeding 0.6 metres in height placed within the sight lines.
Reason:-
In the interests of highway safety.

Within two months of the date of this decision, the car parking spaces, the amenity space and the general landscaping both to the front and rear shall be provided in accordance with details shown on drawings numbered 123F and 124B hereby approved and layout shall be retained as such thereafter
Reason:-

In the interests of the visual amenities as well as the general amenities of the existing and future occupier of the site and to ensure that car parking accommodation is made permanently available to the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority in the interest of highway safety..

The room shown on drawings numbered 123F and 124B as being provided for cycle storage shall be used only for the purposes of cycle storage and other storage incidental to the enjoyment of the residents of the block of flats and shall be retained permanently for such use.
Reason;

In the interests of the amenities of the existing and future occupier of the site and to ensure that cycle parking accommodation is made permanently available to the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority in the interest of highway safety and the amenities of the occupiers of the site.

Within two months of the date of this decision, the internal doors between the rear extension and the living rooms of the ground floor flats shall be removed and in two full size windows, with the height is 2000mm and width of 1050mm x2, shall be installed as indicated in drawings numbered 123F and 124B hereby approved and retained as such thereafter.
Reason:-
To ensure there would be adequate daylight to the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority in the interest of the amenities of the existing and future occupiers of the site.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, no window or other opening (other than those shown on the submitted and approved plan,) shall be formed in the flank walls (including the roof slopes) of the building hereby permitted, unless specific permission under the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 has first been sought and obtained in writing from the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-
In order to ensure a satisfactory development that will not result in any loss of privacy or damage to the environment of neighbouring properties which exist or may be proposed in the future.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:-
In the interests of the amenity of the occupiers of neighbouring dwelling.

Within two months of the date of this decision, the refuse and recycle storage facilities as shown on the drawings numbered  123F and 124B hereby approved shall be provided and retained as such thereafter.
Reason:-

Insufficient information has been supplied with the application to judge how refuse and recycling will be managed on site.  Submission of this detail prior to occupation in the case of new building works or prior to the use commencing in the case of changes of use will protect the amenity of occupiers of the development and also the locality generally.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
Reason:-
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
The applicant's attention is drawn in particular to conditions number 1, 2, 3 and above.  Failure to comply with this condition may well result in enforcement proceedings being taken against you.

The proposal involves works which affect the highway and/or its verge.  Before commencing such works you must obtain separate consent of the Highway Authority.  Please contact the Streetcare on 01708 432563.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the applicants agent. The amendments were subsequently submitted on 05.01.2022..

This planning permission does not remove the need to obtain any separate consent of the owner of the adjoining property prior to commencing building works on, under, above or immediately adjacent to their property (e.g. foundations or guttering). The Party Wall Etc. Act 1996 contains requirements to serve notice on adjoining owners of property under certain circumstances, and a procedure exists for resolving disputes. This is a matter of civil law between the two parties, and the Local Planning Authority are not involved in such matters.
A free guide called "The Party Wall Etc Act 1996: Explanatory Booklet" is available on the website of the Department for Communities and Local Government.
